name: Sixiang
overview: A single screen sokoban style 2D puzzler game developed by Günter Krämer of SoftTouch and released by Kingsoft in 1989. Though the high score table says someone finished level 50, only 25 levels were made. You are a store-keeper in a modern factory and your task is to keep the warehouse in order. You are in control of a small vehicle, which allows you to move boxes and barrels to their destination easily. One day, after a big load has just arrived, you are asked to move the whole goods received to their destination. Happily you start without to know what will expect you. After a short time, you notice that the whole load is in a mess and it will take you a lot of time and reflection to move everything into the right place. So sit down in your vehicle and start your work. Unfortunately you got to hurry up as well, because tomorrow morning your boss will examine the stock.
